fields.description: Preflight checks run twice for any given migration plan. It would be very helpful to expose a progress percentage or bar tracking how far JCMA has completed the preflight checks.
fields.summary: Add a status progress bar for JCMA preflight checks

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After importing Trello projects to Jira, attachments that are linked in Trello cards show up broken in Jira

h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. In Trello, attach attachments (Image file, PDF, documents) to an existing card as an attachment.
2. In Jira settings, import your Trello projects to your JIRA's tenant using the *External System Import* tool.

 !image-2021-08-26-14-42-39-338.png|thumbnail! 


h3. Expected Results

Attachments in the imported issues should show up correctly in Jira.

h3. Actual Results

Attachments that are imported from Trello from Jira shows up broken
 !image-2021-08-26-14-44-47-054.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-08-26-14-45-12-107.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
No workaround known
fields.summary: Attachments imported from Trello shows up broken on Jira

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Site exports (backup) for large instances are failing with "Export error".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
On a large cloud instance e.g with 2 TB of attachments
 # Access the Backup manager in <instance URL>/secure/admin/CloudExport.jspa 
# Tick checkbox to include attachment and media files, if not ticket
# Click create backup to trigger backup


h3. Expected Results
It should eventually complete the backup

h3. Actual Results
Backup runs for about 2 days and eventually fails with an error
{code:java}
Export error
{code}

h3. Workaround
-
fields.summary: Site exports (backup) for large instances fail

fields.description:
Currently JCMA checks for the updated version each time before a migration plan is ran. In order to bypass this check, the Migration Support team has to make a configuration change to a given tenant so that this check doesn't fail and prohibit the admin from running a plan. 

Since many customers would not want to change the plugin version they are testing, especially right before a migration, it seems practical to provide them an option to self service this.
fields.summary: Provide a mechanism for admins to bypass the upgrade JCMA version check

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Update Due Date field with special marker {{<<\!clear\!>>}} through CSV import cause error
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Update issue by CSV from _Administration > System > External System Import_
 # Mapping "Due Date" system field to {{<<\!clear\!>>}} value field in CSV
 # Begin Import

h3. Expected Results
Import work properly or display proper error.

h3. Actual Results
Unexpected failure occurred.
 !Screen Shot 2019-04-19 at 11.48.26.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Use [Bulk Change|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracoreserver/editing-multiple-issues-at-the-same-time-939937916.html] instead of CSV import.
fields.summary: Update Due Date field with special marker <<!clear!>> through CSV import cause error

fields.description:
(i) This ticket has been raised to track interest in an automated migration path for Cloud Forge apps.

h3. Problem Definition
A vendor with a server app cannot provide an automated migration path to a Forge app.
Currently only Atlassian Connect apps provide and support an automated migration path.

h3. Suggested Solution
Provide an automated migration path.


h3. Workaround
Today vendors can provide an app data migration path outside of the Cloud Migration Assistants. The Migration Assistants support displaying the vendor documentation using the [Marketplace Migration API|https://developer.atlassian.com/platform/marketplace/rest/v2/api-group-migrations/#api-group-migrations].
fields.summary: Provide a migration path to the Cloud Forge counterpart of a Server apps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant to migrate to a Jira Cloud site it fails with 
{code:java}
IllegalArgumentException: Project permission [MANAGE_SPRINTS_PERMISSION] does not exist. {code}
when Jira Softare is not enabled in Cloud.

!jira-software.png|width=339,height=178!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate to a Jira Cloud that does not have Jira Software enabled

h3. Expected Results

The migration completes successfully.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the migration log file:
{noformat}
2021-08-19 06:03:49.024 ERROR ABC project-import We couldn't import Permission Scheme 'Default software scheme'. Reason: IllegalArgumentException: Project permission [MANAGE_SPRINTS_PERMISSION] does not exist. This caused 20 other items to fail.:
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

The issue is caused by having a site that does not have Jira Software enabled as this required for the permission {{[MANAGE_SPRINTS_PERMISSION]}}. 

To resolve this, please ensure Jira Software is enabled in your cloud site.
fields.summary: Migrating with JCMA to a site with only Jira Service Management fails with Permission Scheme error

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant to migrate from server to cloud, on some specific cloud sites, we consistently find page mappings are missing.

This does not happen on all cloud sites, but is reproducible on the ones that do fail.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate with CCMA from Server to Cloud
 # Make a request for mappings for {{confluence:page}}

h3. Expected Results

Paginated mappings return as expected.
h3. Actual Results

No mappings are returned.
h3. Workaround

We have a current workaround for this: if you are having this issue with a specific cloud site please open a support ticket, reference this ticket (MIG-768) and request support to update the feature flags to allow for the correct mappings to be provided.
fields.summary: Mappings are not available when migrating with CCMA on certain cloud sites

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira cloud migration using JCMA, migrates the context of the field 'Flagged' which results in two contexts for the field.

As a result, the 'Flagged' field does not work as intended. 
h3. Expected Results

After migration, only one context for the field 'Flagged' should be seen.
h3. Workaround

Deleting the Migrated context and on the other context, making it Global would resolve the issue.
fields.summary: Migration using JCMA migrates the context of the field 'Flagged' which results in two contexts for the field

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Cloud Migration Assistant doesn't appear to be evaluating which users/groups to migrate correctly. The preflight checks evaluate an inaccurate number on Jira Cloud Migration Assistant version 1.5.8 and higher.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Jira Server with users in the internal directory. Run counts from the database and validate how many users you have
 # Set up a test migration plan and note that the counts returned appear to be consistent with the counts returned from the database
 # Set up an upstream Crowd Server and Import test users to Crowd Server via CSV
 # From Jira Server, integrate with upstream Crowd and sync down the users
 # Run counts from the database and note that your total user count has increased by the test users you've synced from Crowd
 # Set up another test migration plan with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant 1.5.8

h3. Expected Results

Jira Cloud Migration Assistant will calculate the user/groups correctly by evaluating both the internal and external directories since they are both active.
h3. Actual Results

The migration plan is not picking up the users that have been synced to the Server. You can verify this by comparing the counts found in preflight vs the counts returned from cwd_user DB table in Jira Sever. Restarting Jira Server nor clearing the context app cache changes this behavior.
{code:java}
curl -X DELETE -u charlie <HOST>/rest/internal/1.0/cache/app
{code}
 # Uninstall Jira Cloud Migration Assistant 1.5.8 and install Jira Cloud Migration Assistant 1.5.7 from the marketplace
 # Create a new migration plan and notice that the counts are accurate once more.

h3. Workaround
 # Uninstall Jira Cloud Migration Assistant 1.5.8 and install Jira Cloud Migration Assistant 1.5.7 from the marketplace
 # Have Migration Support enable a feature flag to bypass the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant upgrade check.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant 1.5.8 user/group migration is not evaluating which users/groups to migrate correctly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The following errors are thrown when using JCMA for migration:
{noformat}
2021-08-09 08:03:33,555 attachments-uploader-pool-1-thread-848610 INFO 56x129355x2 testuser /rest/plugins/1.0/available/featured [c.a.j.m.workers.attachments.AttachmentsUploader] FileMediaId = 79cc3879-b038-46ab-bd70-9f62a579cb0b, Retrying upload creation, Media error: Received an unexpected status code; expected [201], but received 400: Bad Request
{noformat}
{noformat}
2021-08-09 08:03:33,559 pool-32671-thread-6 WARN 56x129355x2 testuser  /rest/plugins/1.0/available/featured [c.a.j.m.workers.attachments.AttachmentProcessor] 3ed08135-57e8-4e52-8654-921a5e170f16-attachmentsUpload#SC$131158092e106ed7eb05f4d1f3beeafdc27fc2285e5eafa0524137418c948ebc: error in attachments upload task for project key SC
com.atlassian.jira.migration.workers.attachments.AttachmentUploadException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Failed to generate Media FileIds for attachments after 3 retries
{noformat}



h3. Steps to Reproduce
Use JCMA with Oracle Database.
h3. Expected Results
Migration to be sucessfull
h3. Actual Results
Migration fails with error

h3. Notes
The issue is seen in Environments having *Oracle Database*. If you have seen the same error on a different database, it could be the same symptom but different root cause. Please contact Atlassian Support for further investigation.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Received an unexpected status code; expected [201], but received 400: Bad Request - Error when migrating attachments using JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JCMA already has an *attachment only* and *configuration only* backend mechanism. It would be good to have a "data only" migration so the tool can be leveraged to migrate issues/attachments without the whole complexity of fixing configuration metadata that is not supported in Cloud (e.g. workflows)

For example, having the ability to migrate issues/attachments and associating them with the default vanilla schemes/workflows/etc so that admins have the ability to migrate the data easier and do post-migration config mapping later.
fields.summary: Create a "Data Only" Migration with JCMA

fields.description:
[What Gets Migrated with JCMA|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant/]

Currently JCMA doesn't migrate a filter's favorite status though the filter itself does get migrated. It would be great to migrate the favorite along with it as users may rely on this favorite status to be able to find their most used/referenced objects quickly. 

The favorite status could be applied as part of post migration tasks by leveraging the Jira Cloud REST API

https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/api-group-filters/#api-rest-api-3-filter-id-favourite-put
fields.summary: JCMA should retain Favorites on Filters that are migrated

fields.description:
It would be great if JCMA (Jira cloud migration assistant) could migrate Jira mail servers and mail handlers during the migration. 

As a customer I want an added option in JCMA UI in server along with projects and User&Groups, to choose when I want to migrate Jira Server and Mail Handlers from Server / DC to Cloud. 

During test migrations, I don't want the mail handlers to migrate across but I want them migrated during prod migrations only.
fields.summary: Jira cloud migration assistant does not migrate mail handlers and mail servers

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When installing or enabling [Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1222010/jira-cloud-migration-assistant?hosting=server&tab=overview] at a Jira instance with a large set of user accounts, it can fail to start due to timeout.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira at any version compatible with JCMA 1.5.7 
# Populate it with a large number of accounts (e.g 100k+ users)
# Install JCMA 1.5.7

h3. Expected Results
JCMA 1.5.7 will be enabled successfully before the default plugin timeout (300 seconds).

h3. Actual Results
JCMA fails to be enabled due to timeout.

When generating thread dumps while JCMA is being enabled, a long running thread with the following pattern can be identified:
{noformat}
"ThreadPoolAsyncTaskExecutor::Thread 7" #393 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007f6b2ebd6000 nid=0xdd197 runnable [0x00007f665d837000]
   java.lang.Thread.State: RUNNABLE
    at java.net.SocketInputStream.socketRead0(Native Method)
  ...
    at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeQuery(PgPreparedStatement.java:114)
  ...
    at com.atlassian.jira.migration.serverdataextractors.usergroup.JiraDirectoryService.fetchUsersWithAttributes(JiraDirectoryService.kt:69)
  ...
    at com.atlassian.jira.migration.email.NewEmailSuggestingService.buildDomainNameMap(NewEmailSuggestingService.kt:72)
{noformat}

h3. Workaround
* Reduce the number of user accounts on Jira. As a recommended approach, [this|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/find-the-last-login-date-for-a-user-in-jira-server-363364638.html] KB article can be used to identify accounts that are not needed anymore, so they can be deleted if possible.
* Try [increasing the plugin timeout|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/bundled-plugin-not-available-error-thrown-on-jira-server-login-212173447.html] on Jira. The default timeout value is 300 seconds, so users can modify *atlassian.plugins.enable.wait* to a larger value (e.g. 600 seconds) to enable JCMA in this situation.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud Migration Assistant (JCMA) can fail to be enabled at environments with a large number of user accounts

fields.description: Currently if JCMA fails a plan migration, it will error out but doesn't offer an option to make small adjustments and retry the same plan. The Admin must create a brand new plan to re-run a failed migration attempt.
fields.summary: JCMA doesn't offer any option to re-run a failed migration plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While migrating JSM project via JSM JCMA plugin, Approvals may fail to migrate due to partial information being sent to the cloud destination site.

+Additional Notes:+

Approvals are configured within a workflow and it has been identified that workflow meta attributes required by Approvals isn't being exported by JCMA. This is the root cause for such type of errors.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

To be added
h3. Expected Results

Approvals should migrate to cloud
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log:
{noformat}
XX-project-errors.log:2021-08-02 03:19:31.008 ERROR XX project-import We couldn't import {{mri:mig:jira/servicedesk:approval:199}}. Reason: 400 Bad Request: [{"errors":[{"errorMessage":"Approval is not configured for status."}],"reasonKey":"sd.approval.error.approval.not.configured","reasonCode":"400"}].
{noformat}
h3. Solution

Re-migrate with JCMA custom JAR *v27* from dropbox link shared in JSM EAP program
h3. -Workaround-

-Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available. However since the fix has been identified, it should be made available in the next JSM JCMA release.-
fields.summary: Approval import fails with error message - "Approval is not configured for status"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Queues (and other entities, example: reports) that contain JQL which references custom fields fail to migrate.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # For a give JSM project's queue update the JQL to reference any custom field
 # Migrate JSM project via JSM JCMA plugin

h3. Expected Results

JSM entities should migrate to cloud
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
XX-project-errors.log:2021-08-02 03:51:35.099 ERROR XX project-import We couldn't import {{mri:mig:jira/servicedesk:queue:13}}. Reason: 400 Bad Request: [{"reasonKey":"sd.admin.queue.general.error.incompletefields","errors":{"jql":"Not able to sort using field 'cf[11200]'."}}].
{noformat}
h3. Solution

Fix has been implemented, enable documented FF for respective tenant.
h3. -Workaround-

-Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available-
fields.summary: Queues fail to import due to unidentified reference of custom field in JQL

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

While using the JSM-JCMA plugin to migrate JSM project, Issues will fail to export if "Project Lead" for respective JSM project doesn't have sufficient permissions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

NOTES:
 * *User A* is migration admin
 * *User B* is a project lead for *JSM project 01*

 # Log in as User A
 # Remove User B from groups providing JSM product access (example: `jira-servicedesk-users`)
 # Migrate JSM project 01 using JSM-JCMA

h3. Expected Results

JSM project should have migrated with all its respective Issues.
h3. Actual Results

The below exception is thrown in the JCMA error log file:
{noformat}
XXXX-project-export.log:2021-08-12 15:25:02.700 ERROR XXXX project-export We couldn't export Issue XXXX-1. Reason: java.lang.IllegalStateException: Entity mri:mig:jira/servicedesk:requestType:16 is expected to be exported, but it was not.
{noformat}
h3. Solution

Re-migrate with JCMA custom JAR *v27* from dropbox link shared in JSM EAP program
h3. -Workaround-

-Following are some workaround options-
 # -Provide sufficient permissions to the current "Project Lead"-
 # -Assign another "Project Lead" one that has sufficient permissions-

-then re-migrate the JSM project.-
fields.summary: Issues fail to export because dependant Request Type weren't exported

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

With attachment only dark feature enabled users are unable to change 'Project data' option from 'Attachments only' to 'All' directly without removing all projects from the plan first.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable dark feature for attachment only migration in JCMA
 # Create new migration plan in JCMA
 # When selecting projects to migrate select 'Attachment only' option and save
 # Try editing option to change from 'Attachment only' to 'All' project data

h3. Expected Results

Able to select radio button for 'All' option and save changes
h3. Actual Results

Unable to select radio button for 'All' option
h3. Workaround
 # Edit migration plan to remove all projects from plan and save changes
 # Edit migration plan again and select projects to migrate again
 # You'll now have the option to choose between 'Attachment only' and 'All' project data migration so you can save
fields.summary: Unable to switch directly from attachment only to full project migration in JCMA

fields.description: Required Field Validators have an optional error message. The optional error message cannot be migrated from Server/DC -> Cloud.
fields.summary: Missing Required Field Validator optional message

fields.description:
[JSU Automation Suite for Jira Workflows|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/5048/jsu-automation-suite-for-jira-workflows?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] has conditions in server that map to native Jira cloud workflow conditions. 

The conditions are:
* Users in any group
* Users in any project roles

JCMA does not migrate these conditions nor does JSU Automation Suite for Jira Workflow.
fields.summary: Missing JSU Automation Suite for Jira Workflows to native Jira cloud workflow conditions

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Customers that are doing acquisitions or would like to consolidate their cloud instances into a single cloud site, will require to perform a confluence cloud to cloud migration. 

Currently, the only option to perform a Confluence Cloud to Cloud migration/consolidation is to export and import individual space export and import, following this process [import-a-confluence-cloud-space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/import-a-confluence-cloud-space/] which is extensive work if there are big spaces that will need to be manually downloaded and uploaded or if there are a huge amount of spaces to be migrated.
h3. Suggested Solution

Similar to the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, build a tool to automatically perform a Confluence Cloud space migration.
h3. Workaround

An alternative is also to generate a full Confluence site backup and import this into a temporary server and use the existing Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant for server, but that will imply additional downtime for the total time to migrate and risks due to additional tasks involved.
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud to Cloud migration tooling

fields.description:
h3. *Problem:* 

Current site import does not allow to use JCMA App data migration feature. This has current a high impact as some Apps do not have a defined migration path towards Cloud (except migrating the projects using the JCMA tooling).  
h3. *Suggestions:*

Allow an option to use the JCMA App data migration feature when using Site import during the cloud migration **
fields.summary: Automation of App data migration when using Site Import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attempting bulk create issues (through a CSV file) using email addresses for custom user picker fields results in error.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Press the global _Create_ button. 
# In the Create issue dialog, press the _Import_ button to move to the bulk Create screen:  !image-2021-08-10-14-02-26-701.png|thumbnail! 
# Upload a CSV file, the file must contain email addresses to map with custom user picker fields.
# Map the email data from the CSV files to the a custom user picker field during the import process.
# Finish the import process.

h3. Expected Results
Th issues are created, and the emails mapped result in the corresponding user set in the user picker fields.

h3. Actual Results
An error in shown, indicating "Issue can't be created due to the error/s [ User '<email address>' was not found in the system. ]"

h3. Workarounds
* Use the AAID instead of the email.
* Use the full External System Import option instead of the Bulk Create.
fields.summary: Attempting bulk create issues (through a CSV file) using email addresses for custom user picker fields results in error

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently CCMA does not support migration of spaces which are already present in cloud, we first need to delete them and then migrate the space.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be hepful if we can have differential migration feature in CCMA. Have a migration saved in the source system, then click a button and the CCMA would take the page diffs, find the corresponding pages in the target system, and just apply the changes. This helps because oftentimes, users keep working in the source systems even as we do the initial migration.
Also, we should have an option in CCMA to provide an updated space key when we don't want to merge with the space already existing in Cloud.
fields.summary: CCMA to support incremental migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Name of the attachments with a leading whitespace character are not displayed in UI post migration.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Tested with CCMA version 3.20.
#  Migrate the space to the cloud site.
#  In the cloud site the attachments sections will show both the images but in the UI images whose name has a leading empty space will show up as ?Unknown attachment.
#  But in the database of the cloud site the entry for the second screenshot does not have any leading whitespace character.
#  The issue persists in space import as well.

h3. Expected Results

Images whose name with the leading whitespace character should be imported correctly.
h3. Actual Results

UI is showing the images as *?UnknownAttachments*
h3. Workaround

Delete the images from the page and re-upload the image by editing the name without having whitespace character.
fields.summary: Attachment names with leading whitespace character broken after migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JCMA will try to migrate change history items from Server to Cloud via groups of items. If one of the items in the group is [not supported|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/what-gets-migrated-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant/]  via JCMA (e.g. multi version picker), the rest of the change history items in that group will not make it to cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
These steps are hard to replicate and depend on the order in which change group items are attempted to be migrated to Cloud:
 # Create an unsupported change history item in Server (e.g. unsupported custom field change)
 # Migrate to Cloud
 # If the supported change history items is in a group with an unsupported item, all items will not make it through

In this example, there's 6 items in the import group, if one of them is not supported (e.g. custom field), none of the change history items will make it over *for that issue*.

 !cloud group.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Only the unsupported items in the change history are not migrated to cloud

h3. Actual Results
Any other change history items in that batch will not make it through to Cloud

h3. Workaround
None Available so far
fields.summary: Change History Migration fails if some dependencies fails via JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

[Media Site Import with old attachment file directory from Server|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/use-jira-site-import-to-migrate-from-server-to-cloud/] sometimes will succeed without any error message, but there is a defect of attachment in Cloud.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

0.Use Jira 7.13.1 later version, but the following old attachment file directory(JIRA versions 4.2 and earlier) is remaining in their server.
{code:java}
- old file attachment directory(JIRA versions 4.2 and earlier)
<JIRA_HOME>/attachments/<PROJECT>/<ISSUE_ID>/<ID>_name_of_the_file

- later
<JIRA_HOME>/attachments/<PROJECT>/<ISSUE_ID>/<ID>
{code}

1.Make Media Site Import File with the following old attachment file directory.

2.Execute Media Site Import and check the result of Site media import

h3. Expected Results
 - Media Site Import failed with error detail(Wrong file directory).

h3. Actual Results
 - Sometimes Media Site Import failed or *stopped without any error message* .
 - Sometimes Media Site Import shows success, *but we can't open attachments in Jira Cloud(there is the record of attachment in DB)*.

h3. Workaround

Fix the attachment path in Server with using [Knowledge base: JIRA Unable to Find Attachments|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-unable-to-find-attachments-269984254.html] at first.
fields.summary: Media Site Import with old attachment file directory from Server sometimes will succeed without any error message, but there is a defect of attachment in Cloud.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JCMA fails to migrate filters owned by inactive users. The error is misleading as it will indicate that the owned by an inactive user is a Cross-project filter
{code:java}
Unsupported	CAP	Board	"FILTER_NAME" [985]	Cross-project board	Boards that reference multiple projects are not supported via migration. This board will not be migrated.	If you require this board, re-create the board in your cloud site. To pull out the JQL for board filters, run SQL queries from this page: https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/troubleshooting-errors-and-non-migrated-entities-with-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-1021239878.html
{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # have a filter that is owned by an inactive user
 # try to migrate the project that has a board associated with that filter

h3. Expected Results

JCMA should migrate that project and filters
h3. Actual Results

JCMA finishes, but the Post Migration will complain about the *{{Cross-project board Boards that reference multiple projects are not supported via migration}}* and the particular project will not migrate
h3. Workaround

Make sure to associate the filters with active users
fields.summary: JCMA fails to migrate filters owned by inactive users

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Both Jira Server/DC and Cloud allow duplication of the custom field name. https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-67591
If the custom fields are already duplicated in Server/DC, JCMA marks them as "migrated" in the Cloud without keeping the name as they have been.   

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create two "customfieldtest" custom fields in Server/DC
 # Migrate projects to Cloud with JCMA

h3. Expected Results
two "customfieldtest" custom fields are created in Cloud

h3. Actual Results
"customfieldtest" and "customfieldtest (migrated)" is created in Cloud

h3. Workaround
Avoid the duplication of the custom field name
fields.summary: Custom field is marked as "migrated" even when the field is duplicated in Server/DC

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On the Server, if a Page contains a Page Properties Report macro that includes a parent (page), the user sees the Page Name. Once the Page is migrated to Confluence Cloud, the macro is broken because the parent Page will be pointing to the Server Page ID.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create Page on Confluence Server. Add Macro "Page Properties Report"
 # Configure macro to include *With parent* configuration by typing and selecting a page.
# Notice that the Page name is displayed. Save the macro and publish the page.
# Migration to Cloud using Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
# Navigate to the same page in Cloud
# The macro will show "No content found"
# Select edit and observe the same "With parent" setting shows a Page ID and not the Page Title. 

h3. Expected Results
# When migrating, the Page ID value should get updated to the new Page ID in Cloud.

h3. Actual Results
# The Page ID remains the same. As a result, "No content found" will appear.
# Further misleading will be that users were able to view the Page Title on Server and now are seeing an ID.
** The value from the Server database always references the ID: {code}<ac:parameter ac:name="cql">label = "testlabel" and space = currentSpace() and parent = "884739"</ac:parameter></ac:structured-macro>{code}
** 884739 is the Page Title. In the UI the user only sees the Page Title.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Migration Assistant does not update Page IDs stored within Page Properties Report Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Updating custom fields in existing jira issues via CSV import in Team Managed projects results in the following error message:
{code:java}
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: At least one given IssueParentAssociations must not be empty!{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1) Create a CSV file with 40 entries in the following format:
{code:java}
Summary, key
Test 1, TEAM-1
Test 2, TEAM-2
.
.{code}
2) Import the issues via the above CSV file into a team managed project using the External System Importer

3) Create a date custom field in the team managed project

4) Update CSV file such that all 40 issues have date field populated
{code:java}
Summary, key, Date
Test 1, TEAM-1, 21/JUL/21
Test 2, TEAM-2, 22/JUL/21
.
.{code}
5) Import the CSV file again to the same project such that the date custom field in the issues are updated.
h3. Expected Results

The CSV import operation is successful and the date field values are updated.
h3. Actual Results

The following error message is seen on screen and only the first issue in the CSV file has the date field updated:
{code:java}
Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data may be in an unstable state: At least one given IssueParentAssociations must not be empty!{code}
h3. Workaround

The importer seems to look for a Parent Association for the imported issue and if it does not exists, it fails. To workaround this behaviour:
 1) Create a test epic in the team managed project
 2) Perform bulk operation to link the issues that are updated via CSV to this test parent epic
 3) Import CSV file to update the date custom field successfully
fields.summary: Updating custom fields in existing jira issues via CSV import in Team Managed projects results in the error: "At least one given IssueParentAssociations must not be empty"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unable to migrate all boards due missing of {{OLD_DONE_ISSUES_CUTOFF}} column on {{AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW}} column

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install Jira v7.7
# Create some Software projects
# Enable the dark features to migrate all boards and filters
# Migrate the projects to Cloud using Jira Cloud Migration Assistant

h3. Expected Results
Migration goes through successfully

h3. Actual Results
* Migration couldn't pass the pre-flight check and shows error in the logs:
{code}
2021-08-02 11:26:43,569 pool-56-thread-25 ERROR admin 686x1445x1 znp2rw 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /rest/migration/latest/check/d7383ebaab1aa90bcace13fda8e0cfec06565b0d [c.a.j.m.export.framework.DefaultExportFailureHandler] d7383ebaab1aa90bcace13fda8e0cfec06565b0d: Exporting referenced entities by Project KAN failed
com.querydsl.core.QueryException: Caught PSQLException for select distinct "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."ID", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."NAME", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."SAVED_FILTER_ID", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."CARD_COLOR_STRATEGY", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."OLD_DONE_ISSUES_CUTOFF", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."OWNER_USER_NAME", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."SHOW_DAYS_IN_COLUMN", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."SHOW_EPIC_AS_PANEL", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."SPRINTS_ENABLED", "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."SWIMLANE_STRATEGY" from "public"."AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW" order by "AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW"."ID" asc limit ? offset ?
.
.
.
.
.
.
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: column AO_60DB71_RAPIDVIEW.OLD_DONE_ISSUES_CUTOFF does not exist
  Position: 161
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2455)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2155)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:288)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeInternal(PgStatement.java:430)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeWithFlags(PgPreparedStatement.java:168)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgPreparedStatement.executeQuery(PgPreparedStatement.java:116)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:83)
	at org.apache.commons.dbcp2.DelegatingPreparedStatement.executeQuery(DelegatingPreparedStatement.java:83)
	at com.querydsl.sql.AbstractSQLQuery.fetch(AbstractSQLQuery.java:446)
	... 50 more
{code}

h3. Notes
* JCMA supports version 7.6.0 or later as documented [here|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/supported-versions-for-the-jira-cloud-migration-assistant/]
* However, {{OLD_DONE_ISSUES_CUTOFF}} column is meant for "Hide completed issues older than" feature, and it was introduced on 7.6.5, 7.8.2, 7.9.0 and later. *Some versions between 7.6 - 7.9 don't have this feature.*
* Managed to reproduce the error on 7.7.0 & 7.8.0. The migration works on 7.6.5.
* Affected version:
{code}
7.6.0, 7.6.1, 7.6.2, 7.6.3, 7.6.4
7.7.0, 7.7.1, 7.7.2, 7.7.3, 7.7.4
7.8.0, 7.8.1
{code}

h3. Workaround
Upgrade to 7.6.5, 7.8.2, 7.9.0 or later, which contain "Hide completed issues older than" feature
fields.summary: Migrate all boards feature is not working in some versions

fields.description:
Right now the site import task does display the time taken while running, but as soon as it completes that time is lost. For long-running processes this can be upwards of 12 hours and may stop in the middle of the night. Organizations should know approximately how long to expect for a site import like this so they can plan their production cutover appropriately.

In summary, it's hard to plan for a long site import if you don't know how long your tests took.
fields.summary: Keep Total Import Time on the Jira Site Import Page Once Import is Complete

fields.description:
For the majority of the JCMA migrations it's necessary to run them in sequence, one plan after the other, to avoid any performance issue. However, when doing so, it's difficult to keep track of when a migration finishes so that the next one can be started. 

It would be helpful to implement a feature within the JCMA that could send an email informinging that a plan has been completed.
fields.summary: After a migration plan is completed, allow the JCMA to send an email informing that the plan is finished

fields.description: Although it is possible to estimate that based JCMA entries on the *atlassian-jira.log* files, it would be very helpful to include that information on the post-migration reports. Having that information easily at hand can help the prioritization and planning of large migrations.
fields.summary: Provide total migration time for a JCMA plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When custom fields with the *_same name_* are used in different Team-managed projects, then exporting the file which includes the column for this custom field from the issue search navigator for a particular project, the custom field column will be duplicated and will include the custom fields of the same name from other Team-managed projects. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create custom fields with the *_same name_* in more than one team-managed project.
 # In the advanced issue search include this custom field column and filter for one particular project
# Choose "Export with *current fields*".

h3. Expected Results
Only the custom field of the select project should be exported in the file.

h3. Actual Results
The custom field columns are duplicated in the exported file which includes the same custom fields from other team-managed projects.

h3. Workaround
Create a unique custom field name or use a 'Project Suffix' for Team-managed projects.
fields.summary: When "Exporting with current fields" using custom fields for a team-managed project, the column configuration is not respected.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Site Import does not clear the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant Scope tables

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Migrate some projects with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant from Server 1 to a cloud site (lets call is abc.atlassian.net)
# Create a backup from another source Server / DC instance (Server 2)
# Import the backup from Server 2 using site import to abc.atlassian.net
# Migrate some projects from Server 1 to abc.atlassian.net using Jira Cloud migration assistant

h3. Expected Results
* Data migrated with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant does not interfere with existing cloud data and does not over write it. 

h3. Actual Results
* Data migrated with Jira Cloud Migration Assistant can interfere with existing cloud data and may over write it. 


h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Site Import does not clear the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant Scope tables

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When Atlassian support imports users and groups on behalf of a customer, user/group/directory information must be stripped of from the XML before it can be imported onto the cloud.
However,  when doing a site import by removing the internal directory information from the XML the import fails.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
* Extracted the Users straight from backup.
* Remove users and groups from xml
* Remove external directories from XML file using command below:

sed -i '' '/<Directory id=/d' entities.xml

fields.description:
JCMA migrates few workflow rules that belong to Marketplace partner apps on server side as a native workflow rule to Jira Cloud. Here's the list of such workflow rules,

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/workflow-rules-migrated-via-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-1031838515.html]

Migration of these workflow rules will fail if its configuration contains references to Jira Service Management custom fields that are not supported by JCMA.

We've received a request from a Marketplace partner to support this use case. Here are the samples of such custom fields,
 com.atlassian.servicedesk.approvals-plugin:sd-approvals
 com.atlassian.servicedesk:vp-origin
 com.atlassian.servicedesk:sd-customer-organizations
 com.atlassian.servicedesk:sd-request-participants
 com.atlassian.servicedesk:sd-request-feedback
 com.atlassian.servicedesk:sd-request-feedback-date
fields.summary: Support migrating native workflow rules with configurations referring to Jira Service Management custom fields

fields.description:
JCMA migrates few workflow rules that belong to Marketplace partner apps on server side as a native workflow rule to Jira Cloud. Here's the list of such workflow rules,

[https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloudkb/workflow-rules-migrated-via-jira-cloud-migration-assistant-1031838515.html]

We've received a suggestion from a Marketplace partner to provide a way for them to opt out of JCMA natively migrating their workflow rules. For e.g., when a Marketplace partner app provides a mapping for any of the above listed workflow rules via *JiraCloudMigrationListenerV1.getSupportedWorkflowRuleMappings()* app migration interface, JCMA should migrate them as a Connect app workflow rule to Jira cloud instead of migrating them as a native workflow rule.
fields.summary: Provide a way for Marketplace partners to opt out from JCMA natively migrating their workflow rules.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Import via CSV referencing to an e-mail address may associate to the wrong user if an Atlassian Account and Custom Account exist in the same instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JSD portal user '*chris@test.com*' with AAID e.g.: '*qm:123...*'
 # Disable the JSD user '*chris@test.com*'
 # Add the user '*chris@test.com*' under *User management* with AAID e.g.: '*5e09..*.'
 # Import a ticket via CSV assigning to the user's email, as follow below
{code:java}
summary, assignee
test, 'chris@test.com'
{code}

h3. Expected Results

It should assign to the Jira user '*chris@test.com*' with the AAID e.g.: '*5e09..*.'
h3. Actual Results

It will assign to the JSD portal user '*chris@test.com*' with AAID e.g.: '*qm:123...*'
h3. Workaround

As a workaround, we can use the AAID instead of the email.
fields.summary: Import via CSV referencing to an e-mail address may associate to the wrong user if an Atlassian Account and Custom Account exist in the same instance

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we import CSV data into JIRA via System External Import, fields with duplicate names will be somehow mapped to Custom field rather than the System field even if I choose the correct field during the import.

I suspect there is a bug in the CSV Importer around the name of a custom field when selecting it for import, particularly if there is a standard field by the same name.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field named "Status". Not a good idea, but that's what was done.
# Create a CSV file for import with Issue ID, reporter, summary, status columns.
# Use the CSV importer to import the CSV file, mapping as expected. Select the standard JIRA field Status for the status column.
# Note that the custom field named Status is selected since it is named as a custom field, not a standard field in the CSV Importer mapping.

h3. Expected Results
The System field Status should have been updated.

h3. Actual Results
The Custom field Status have been updated.

h3.Workaround
*Option 1*
# After mapping the fields for the import, the import wizard will give you the option to _Begin import_. 
# At this page, click Back button on your web browser.
# Choose again the standard Status field again.

*Option 2*
# Rename the Custom Field to a different name before the import.
# Perform the CSV import.
# Rename back the Custom field back to the original name.
fields.summary: During CSV imports, Jira doesn't respect the field you choose during the mapping step when you have a custom field with the same name of a system field

fields.description:
*(/) Users related to the selected spaces are migrated can only be migrated without the product access.* 

*(x) It is not possible to select the option to migrate users related to the selected spaces with product access*

 

*Steps to reproduce*

In the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, when the option to "Only migrate users related to the selected spaces" is selected,

!5f32b378-b01f-4006-aed9-a8377c013364.png!

It is not possible to select the option to also grant these user product access,

!bf354888-d5e2-46b1-b5fa-6dcecd69883c.jpeg!

 

*Impact*
 * Data created by this user may fail, as the user is migrated without product access and not able to create data until they are granted product access
 * This has been found to block some app migrations, such as is the case with Confluence Questions.

 

*What's expected*

In the Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant, when the option to "Only migrate users related to the selected spaces" is selected, the option to grant the migrated users access to Confluence or not is made available.
fields.summary: When migrating only users related to the selected spaces, I need the option to also grant product access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Differences between {{workflowschemeentity}} and {{jiraworkflows}} tables on how workflow scheme names are stored (for example, different capitalisation) can cause migration to fail when using "Site Import".

(!) _How the workflow scheme names end up in different capitalisation on Jira Server in not known._

This could possible also cause https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/MIG-291 as the exported data may show duplicated workflow schemes. _This is not confirmed._
h3. Steps to Reproduce

See attached ticket on which the bug report is based.
h3. Expected Results

Workflow schemes are migrated successfully and duplicate due to capitalisation is handled gracefully.
h3. Actual Results

Workflow schemes appears to be imported successfully but Jira Cloud Ui appears to favour _case-sensitive_ search for workflow schemes, which Jira Server appears to use _case-insensitive_ search.
h3. Workaround

Fix the capitalisation of workflow scheme names in {{workflowschemeentity}} and {{jiraworkflows}} on Jira Server before migration.
fields.summary: Different capitalisation of workflow scheme names in workflowschemeentity and jiraworkflows tables leads to incorrect view on Cloud after site import

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
JCMA will run all pre-flight checks first when creating the plan and again when attempting to run the plan.  That's by design, in case things have changed between the pre-flight checks and the live migration. However, depending on the size of the migration, these checks can be run for several hours and can extend the time to migrate or put a migration at risk depending on how long they run. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a JCMA plan with thousands of projects
 # Save the plan

h3. Expected Results
The preflight checks will run once

h3. Actual Results
The preflight checks run twice, first before you can save a plan and again before you can actually run it. Depending on how large the data set is, this can run for several hours before you can proceed with the migration. 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JCMA runs prechecks twice, once when saving the plan and again when running it

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.

When a customer migrates from Jira Server / Data Center to Jira Cloud using the Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with Autowatch for Jira to automatically transfer all the relevant configurations.

Gathering the requirements from the existing on-prem customers for the migration functionality.

 !image-2021-03-04-12-57-57-187.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a workflow validator to check the following condition: Field Linked Issues should be modified during the transition.
# Try importing an issue using the CSV file
** Even that the Linked Issue is present, it fails the import

h3. Expected Results
Having the Linked Issue at the CSV file should still create the issue as all the conditions for the workflow validator are valid

h3. Actual Results
The CSV Import fails with the errors:
Unable to link issue from externalID to <existing issue key> with link named 'name of the Link Type': Cannot find imported issue key for external id 'xxxxxx'
Source issue not found

To resolve that, the validator should be removed but will cause to no longer validate if issues are created manually from the issue creation event.

fields.description:
Currently only one value is allowed in {{cloudMigrationAssistantCompatibility}} and this is the minimum version of an app.

This can cause issues with CMAs where there are multiple versions of an app for different versions of Jira or Confluence. For example, a Partner might have an app with versions
 * 4.5.0 for Jira 7 versions only
 * 6.2.0 for Jira 8 versions only

But for {{cloudMigrationAssistantCompatibility}}, if they enter 4.5.0 as the minimum version then anything after 4.5.0 (e.g. 5.x, 6.0 before the 6.2.0 version) will be set as compatible.

h3. Workaround
As semantic versioning is used to compare versions, and Marketplace has the ability to limit versions with a maximum and minimum value, the Partner can use versions like
 * 7.0.0-jira7 for Jira 7 versions only
 * 7.0.0-jira8 for Jira 8 versions only

as the _build information_ section of the version at the end is not used for comparison.
fields.summary: Allow for multiple versions in cloudMigrationAssistantCompatibility

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using CCMA to migrate Spaces, if a page contains an external image with storage format that appears as:
{code:java}
<ac:image>
<ri:url ri:value="http://confluence.atlassian.com/
images/logo/confluence_48_trans.png" /></ac:image>
{code}
The link to the image will be broken in the Cloud preventing the user from seeing the actual image.

Reference: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/confluence-storage-format-790796544.html]
{quote}
h2. Images
|Attached image| {code}<ac:image>
<ri:attachment ri:filename=
"atlassian_logo.gif" />
</ac:image>{code}|
|External image| {code}<ac:image>
<ri:url ri:value="http://confluence.atlassian.com/
images/logo/confluence_48_trans.png" /></ac:image>{code}|
 {quote}
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Confluence server, Edit a page, select Insert Image or File > add attachment to a page. The attachment will appear with the format:
{code:java}
<ac:image>
<ri:attachment ri:filename=
"atlassian_logo.gif" />
</ac:image>{code}
 # On Confluence server, copy the image from page 1 and paste it into the Edit screen of page 2.
 Storage format for the image will appear as an external image:
{code:java}
<ac:image>
<ri:url ri:value="http://confluence.atlassian.com/
images/logo/confluence_48_trans.png" /></ac:image>
{code}
 # Migrate using CCMA

h3. Expected Results

CCMA should migrate both pages and attachments should be visible
h3. Actual Results

Both pages are migrated without errors in the UI. There are also no errors in the logs indicating a problem with external images vs attached image
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: CCMA does not migrate external images

fields.description: JCMA’s scoped users and groups feature is used 60% of the time. When customers' use the JCMA feature, the algorithm that determines which users to migrate does not consider users referenced in app data, which could cause app migrations to fail.
fields.summary: Scoped Users, Groups & Roles for Apps
Being able to detect which entities were migrated in a specific run

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Enable vendors to register webhooks in a declarative way on atlassian-connect.json instead of the API-driven approach we offer.

This would be aligned with the way they declare lifecycle endpoints and it would also simplify things for them.
fields.summary: Enable way to register webhooks in atlassian-connect.json

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Migrated permission schemes, such as *Default Permission Scheme* are migrated and are not merged in cloud but renamed to  *Default Permission Scheme (migrated)* and all migrated projects use these migrated schemes.

The project role *atlassian-addons-project-access* is not added to any of these migrated permission schemes after being migrated.

Because of this apps cannot modify issues. As a result, issue operations fail with {{HTTP 400}} or {{HTTP 403}} status code with a message like {{Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it.}} or  {{You do not have permission to delete issues in this}} project.

This issue affects Jira Core, Jira Software and Jira Service Management.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira Server create a project and use the *Default Permission Scheme*
 # Migrate the project with JCMA
 # In Admin → Issues → Permission schemes check if the migrated *Default Permission Scheme (migrated)* has *atlassian-addons-project-access*
 # Use an app that needs access to the project

h3. Expected Results

Connect REST calls by the app are allowed and return expected data.
h3. Actual Results

Operations fail with {{HTTP 400}} or {{HTTP 403}} status code with a message like {{Issue does not exist or you do not have permission to see it.}} or  {{{{{}You do not have permission to delete issues in this{}}} project.
h3. Workaround
h4. One
 # Migrate the users/groups and projects
 # Change the permission scheme for the project to the *Default Permission Scheme* in cloud that has *atlassian-addons-project-access*
 # Migrate again with users/groups, no projects and just apps

h4. Two

Uninstall and re-install the app. This will apply the project role *atlassian-addons-project-access* to all existing projects. Access will now be available to the app.
fields.summary: App can't access issue data because of a lack of permission in Jira Cloud

fields.description:
The current design of the App migration platform couples server apps with the CMAs. It has brought some issues in the past.

We want to offer to Marketplace partners a way to integrate with the App Migrations Platform without making their Apps dependent on the CMAs.

Apps only need to expose their listener object and the Cloud Migration Assistant will look for them using the features already provided by OSGi.

Some advantages of the new approach:
 * No need to manage dynamic imports

 * No need to import the gateway bean

 * No need to have object accessors

 * No need to register (and unregister) the listener

 * No need to inform the server app key (as we know it from the bundle the listener came from)

 * No need to track changes to OSGi context

 * Apps won't get restarted when CMA restarts

NB: We won't deprecate the old libraries at this moment.
fields.summary: Discoverable App listeners for App Migration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Migrating projects with JCMA causes new issue link types to be created for Epics and Subtasks. Issues associated to these new issue link types will show extra links in the 'Linked Issues' section of a Jira instance.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Make sure the project has issues with either Subtasks or Epic links
 # Migrate to project with JCMA to Cloud

h3. Expected Results

Jira issue shows 'Issues in this epic' and 'Subtasks' only
h3. Actual Results

Linked issues show extra links such as:
 * has Epic
 * is Epic of
 * jira_subtask_inward
 * jira_subtask_outward

h3. Additional Info
 - Only a few subset of Cloud instances are affected by this bug.
 - The instances which are affected by this bug will still see this behavior if they try to migrate new project(s) from server to Cloud.
 - *Issue link type config drift might have similar symptoms to this ticket. (Incorrect issue link types in issue link table and being unable to delete the project from trash).*

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Epic and subtask links migrated incorrectly with JCMA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using app assessment in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant there is an option to install apps on the Cloud instance if available.

Advanced Roadmaps is one of these options but whenever clicking 'Install App' a search page with 0 results appears since Advance Roadmaps is built in to Jira Premium

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Use App Assessment function in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant
 # Set status for 'Advanced Roadmaps' to 'Needed in cloud' and continue
 # After linking with Cloud instance click 'Install App' for Advanced Roadmaps for Jira

h3. Expected Results

No install app button shown for Advanced Roadmaps

h3. Actual Results

Search page with no results loaded:
https://<CLOUD INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/plugins/servlet/ac/com.atlassian.jira.emcee/discover#!/discover/search?query=com.radiantminds.roadmaps-jira

h3. Workaround

Set status of 'Advanced Roadmaps' to 'Not needed in Cloud' instead
fields.summary: Clicking install app for Advanced Roadmaps in Jira App Assessment loads search with no results

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

The new Atlassian App Migration Platform (currently under development) will enable all Atlassian Marketplace Partners apps to build automated migration paths for their apps.
h3. Suggested Solution

When a customer migrates projects from Jira Server / Data Center to Jira Cloud using the Jira Cloud Migration Assistant, the app migration platform will coordinate with JMWE to automatically move JMWE data associated with the migrated projects.
h3. Workaround

While there may be a migration path, the process is manual, which complicated undertaking, please see https://innovalog.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/JMWEC/pages/156172382/Migrating+from+Jira+Server+Data+Center+to+Jira+Cloud
fields.summary: Support migration Jira Misc Workflow Extensions (JMWE)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When "Anyone" group is granted to any permissions, JCMA will show the project has public access on the preflight check.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a project
# Add "Anyone" group to any permission (other than "Browse projects" permission)
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-25 at 9.38.47 am.png|thumbnail! 
# Try to migrate the project with JCMA

h3. Expected Results
Preflight check isn't showing any warning.

h3. Actual Results
Preflight check is showing the project is accessible by public.
 !Screen Shot 2021-06-25 at 9.38.30 am.png|thumbnail! 
This is contradicting with [Jira pre-migration checklist|https://support.atlassian.com/migration/docs/jira-pre-migration-checklist/] where the document checks only "Browse projects" permission.
Also, public users won't able to access the projects without "Browse projects" permission.

h3. Workaround
* Option 1: Remove "Anyone" group from all permissions
* Option 2: Ignore the preflight warning and click "Continue with public access"
fields.summary: Preflight Check on JCMA for public access isn't accurate
Calling gateway.getCloudFeedback(transferId) in Jira Cloud Migration Assistant always returns a HTTP 404

fields.description:
When migrating via CCMA all or some user data will always get migrated depending on the configuration of the migration plan. It would be helpful if users had the option to migrate ONLY content without any user data.

This is beneficial for customers who want to preserve content, but no longer need user mapping. Another use case is when users have been purged on the server and there is no longer a need to recreate the users or set up temp accounts as this will add invalid users to Atlassian Cloud.

h3. Actual Results
# When configuring *Choose what to migrate*, there are only 2 options:
** all users and groups
** only users related to the space

h3. Expected Results
# When configuring *Choose what to migrate*, there would be 3 options:
** all users and groups
** only users related to the space
** no users
fields.summary: Option in CCMA to migrate Spaces only without any user data

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Migrating a single-project board through JCMA without having access to the Project fails to migrate the boards.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Migrate a project with a single project board with no access to it.
 # Go to Cloud site and check for the boards

h3. Expected Results

Single project boards should be migrated
h3. Actual Results

Single project boards are not migrated.
h3. Workaround

Have at least browsing permission on the project before migrating the project with single project boards.
fields.summary: JCMA fails to migrate single project boards without project access

fields.description:
Currently CCMA will alert an admin that a space would allow public access -  however it doesn't expose an option to remove these spaces from a migration plan.

For example, you can do this quickly when the migration planner detects that spaces already exist in target. We should do the same for public settings spaces to make migrations easier.
fields.summary: CCMA should allow you an option to remove spaces with public access settings from a migration plan

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The restore from Cloud to Server fails with the following message in the logs:
{code}2021-06-10 18:48:34,456-0300 JiraImportTaskExecutionThread-1 ERROR diegovb 1128x309x1 1rrq5kr 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/admin/XmlRestore.jspa [c.a.j.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService] Error during ActiveObjects restore
com.atlassian.activeobjects.spi.ActiveObjectsImportExportException: There was an error during import/export with <unknown plugin>:Error executing update for SQL statement 'ALTER TABLE public."AO_2C4E5C_MAILBLOCKLISTS" ADD CONSTRAINT "fk_ao_2c4e5c_mailblocklists_project_id" FOREIGN KEY ("PROJECT_ID") REFERENCES public."PROJECT"("ID")'
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.newImportExportSqlException(ImportExportErrorServiceImpl.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.onSqlException(SqlUtils.java:46)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:37)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.create(ActiveObjectsForeignKeyCreator.java:43)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ForeignKeyAroundImporter.after(ForeignKeyAroundImporter.java:26)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.importer.AbstractImporter.importNode(AbstractImporter.java:47)
	at com.atlassian.dbexporter.DbImporter.importData(DbImporter.java:70)
	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.ActiveObjectsBackup.restore(ActiveObjectsBackup.java:151)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.restoreActiveObjects(DefaultDataImportService.java:574)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.performImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:749)
	at com.atlassian.jira.bc.dataimport.DefaultDataImportService.doImport(DefaultDataImportService.java:323)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.unsafeCall(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:82)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:64)
	at com.atlassian.jira.web.action.setup.DataImportAsyncCommand.call(DataImportAsyncCommand.java:30)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:177)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ImportTaskManagerImpl$TaskCallableDecorator.call(ImportTaskManagerImpl.java:149)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.Executors$RunnableAdapter.call(Executors.java:511)
	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1149)
	at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:624)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748)
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: relation "public.PROJECT" does not exist
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2468)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.processResults(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2211)
	at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.execute(QueryExecutorImpl.java:309)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeInternal(PgStatement.java:446)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.execute(PgStatement.java:370)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeCachedSql(PgStatement.java:297)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeWithFlags(PgStatement.java:274)
	at org.postgresql.jdbc.PgStatement.executeUpdate(PgStatement.java:246)

	at com.atlassian.activeobjects.backup.SqlUtils.executeUpdate(SqlUtils.java:34)
	... 19 more{code}

the downloaded file contains a foreignKey reference to the table project, column id. However, the table and column name are in uppercase:
{code:java}
<foreignKey fromTable="AO_2C4E5C_MAILBLOCKLISTS" fromColumn="PROJECT_ID" toTable="PROJECT" toColumn="ID" />
{code}

This leads to errors when importing on Jira Server. 

(Similar old bug: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-69564)

However, the entire table is not needed on Jira server; it is only used on Jira Cloud.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Export a backup via Setttings -> System -> Backup manager -> Create backup for server
 # Download and unzip the export file
 # Inside the unzipped folder, examine activeobjects.xml
 # It contains a reference to the table {{AO_2C4E5C_MAILBLOCKLISTS}} including the foreignKey causing issues during import.

h3. Expected Results

The table {{AO_2C4E5C_MAILBLOCKLISTS}} should not be exported to Jira Server.
h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround

The problematic line has to be removed from *activeobjects.xml* file:
{code:xml}
    <foreignKey fromTable="AO_2C4E5C_MAILBLOCKLISTS" fromColumn="PROJECT_ID" toTable="PROJECT" toColumn="ID"/>
{code}

The following steps can be used to perform and validate this change:
 # Unzip cloud backup

{code:java}
unzip cloudbackup.zip 
Archive: cloudbackup.zip
 inflating: entities.xml
 inflating: activeobjects.xml{code}

 # Expand xml to multiple lines:

{code:java}
xmllint activeobjects.xml --format > activeobjects_fixed.xml && mv activeobjects_fixed.xml 
activeobjects.xml {code}

 # Remove the foreign key entry.
 # Zip backup back together.

{code:java}
zip -r cloudbackup_fixed.zip activeobjects.xml entities.xml{code}

 # Move the backup to the import directory on the destination instance and perform the import
fields.summary: XML export from Cloud to Server fails to import
JCMA Error Message improvement

fields.description:
When assessing apps and you change status to “Not needed in cloud”, “No decision made”, “Needed in cloud” and so on, it would be easier if the statuses had different colours.

When there are many apps, it’s easy to make a mistake and pick the wrong status. With different colours for different statuses it would be easier to discover such a mistake and also checking that all is correct would be faster.
fields.summary: Assessing apps options to be colour coded

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Importing from Trello into an instance with Jira Software subscription completes with the following warning.
 !Image 2021-06-17 at 7.01.49 PM.jpg|thumbnail! 
This issue is not reproducible in a site without a *Jira Software* Subscription. This is because it creates a *Business(JWM)* project in that case and the custom field *External issue ID* can be found in _/secure/admin/ViewCustomFields.jspa_. As custom fields in *Team Managed* projects are project-scoped, the field doesn't get mapped.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board in *Trello* and create a few lists and cards.
# In a Cloud site that has *Jira Software* Subscription, follow the steps [here|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-cloud-administration/docs/import-data-from-trello/] to import the board into a project in Jira.

h3. Expected Results
A *Team Managed* project is created with all the fields mapped correctly.

h3. Actual Results
A *Team Managed* project is created but the field *External issue ID* couldn't be mapped as it was not found.
Warning as below can be seen in the detailed import log:
{noformat}2021-06-17 13:02:40,921 INFO - Importing issue: [externalId='60cb474247e67c15ed5cb348', summary='a']
2021-06-17 13:02:40,925 WARN - Custom Field [ External issue ID ] was not found and cannot be created{noformat}

h3. Workaround
Change the Field context for External issue ID (present under the custom fields) and made this field global to all projects and issue types. This change will allow the import to go successfully, without any warnings.

 !Screenshot 2021-07-07 at 2.32.25 PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: External issue ID cannot be created in Trello import into Team Managed project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The new version of Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant (3.2.1) introduces an error to help customers identify possible missing attachments. One of the possibilities is attachments with multiple versions, as well as apps that introduce attachments (Draw.io, Gliffy, etc.).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan for Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant
 # Check the missing attachments
 # Validate the actual missing attachments in the source

h3. Workaround for now
 * migration-assistant.disable.missing-attachments-check

h3. Expected Results

Only the actual files that are missing in the system get surfaced during the check.
h3. Actual Results

The list of missing attachments can be larger than what the user was initially expecting.
h3. Workaround

Validate the attachments
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud Migration Assistant checks for missing attachments but gives a mismatched count of missing attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After a Jira site import, users report that any cloud incoming mail server configured is overwritten by the one imported from the backup.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Setup an incoming mail server in Jira Cloud
# Setup an incoming mail server in Jira Server and ensure it is different from the one setup in Step 1
# Take an export from Jira Server and perform a Site Import

h3. Expected Results
The incoming mail server configured in Jira Cloud is not overwritten by the one from the imported backup.

h3. Actual Results
The incoming mail server configured is Jira Cloud is either replaced by the one from the imported backup or just missing.

h3. Workaround
Please [contact Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] in order to have the Default Cloud Mail Server restored in your site.
fields.summary: After site import, the cloud incoming mail server is overwritten

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When accessing an already executing plan in CCMA, the plan details page still displays a message that is a bit misleading that reads *Your plan is about to start* which can be a bit misleading since the plan is likely already well started. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan in CCMA and execute it
 # After you click run and allow it to process for a bit, return to the plan lists page in CCMA 
# Click view details next to your plan

h3. Expected Results
The page should return a message that says something to the effect of "Gathering plan details"

h3. Actual Results
The page shows a message in the UI that says "Your plan is about to start... this may take a few seconds."

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: CCMA still returns the message "Your plan is about to start" even when a plan is already running

fields.description:
Currently, you have to select all the spaces returned from pagination one by one. It would be beneficial to have a select all from the page. 

Currently the only option we expose is to select ALL spaces and not select all spaces returned from a given page of spaces.
fields.summary: CCMA should allow you an option to select all spaces from a page in the space picker

fields.description: Currently there isn't a way to filter out the already *migrated* spaces from a given source. In the case that you are running multiple batched space migrations from source, not having the ability to filter out spaces already moved causes you to have to page through the space picker just to find the spaces that are eligible for migration.
fields.summary: CCMA should allow you an option to filter out migrated spaces from the space picker

fields.description:
h3. Summary

JCMA needs to inform users if they have any development integrations configured on the Jira Server side before migrating to the cloud.
h3. Use Case

If a user is trying to migrate one project that is being referenced via [Smart Commits|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/process-issues-with-smart-commits/] on any SCM which its project key is already in use in the cloud side, JCMA needs to warn, not only the project key already exists in the cloud, but also the consequences of changing the project key either on the server or cloud side, that may lead to permanent loss of the commit references.
fields.summary: JCMA vs Source Code Management (SCM)
